subject: Remove borders and focus outlines from all modal buttons
body:
Consolidated commit for all border/outline removal fixes:
- Remove blue border from Continue with Google button in contact form
- Remove borders from tasks toolbar icon buttons (card/table view)
- Remove borders from tasks toolbar sort button
- Remove focus outlines from modal icon buttons
- Remove focus outlines from task card/table links and checkboxes
- Override global button styles with !important for all modal buttons
- Add focus:outline-none to prevent browser default focus styling

This fixes unwanted blue borders caused by global button styles in styles.css
affecting buttons and links within modals.

Files modified:
- src/app/components/contact/contact-form.ts
- src/app/shared/dev-stats.ts
- src/app/shared/tasks-toolbar.ts
- src/app/shared/task-card.ts
- src/app/shared/task-table.ts

subject: Add git workflow and task management documentation
body:
Updated CLAUDE.md and README.md to include comprehensive documentation about:
- Post-commit hook system and how it works
- Task creation and completion workflow
- Proper commit message format with task tags [Task-N]
- Automatic data file generation and commit behavior
- Push workflow for dual commits

This documentation helps developers and AI assistants understand the
automated task tracking system.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Fix completedCommit hash extraction in post-commit hook
body:
Task 18: Fixed critical bug where fullHash field contained diff content instead
of actual commit hash. The issue occurred when git log with -p flag prepended
diff content to subsequent commit blocks when split by delimiter.

Solution: Use regex to extract 40-character hash from end of parts[0] to handle
cases where diff content is prepended.

[Task-18]

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Refactor dev-stats for single responsibility and fix date logic
body:
Task 16: Refactored dev-stats component to follow single responsibility principle
- Created tasks-container component to encapsulate task-specific state
- Moved task view and sort order state to tasks-container
- Moved sorting logic to tasks-container
- dev-stats now only manages modal and tab state

Task 17: Fixed critical bugs in post-commit hook date logic
- Fixed template literal variable interpolation on line 89
- Fixed template literal variable interpolation in grep command on line 103
- Fixed logic to get newest commit instead of oldest on line 109

[Task-16] [Task-17]

subject: Add task completion tracking and modularize dev-stats [Task-14] [Task-15]
body:
Task 14: Task completion tracking
- Add completedDate and completedCommit fields to Task interface
- Implement git history analysis to detect task completion
- Support dual detection: diff analysis + commit message search
- Display completion dates and linked commits in UI
- Add table/card view toggle and sort by completion date
- Create comprehensive TASKS_FEATURE.md documentation

Task 15: Modularize dev-stats component
- Extract task-card component (individual task display)
- Extract task-table component (tabular task display)
- Extract tasks-toolbar component (view/sort controls)
- Reduce dev-stats.ts from 574 to 239 lines (58% reduction)
- Improve code organization and reusability

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Add Task 14: Track task completion dates via git hooks
body:
This task will test the automated tasks.md -> tasks.json sync system.
The post-commit hook should automatically parse this new task and
add it to tasks.json.

Features to implement:
- Add completedDate field to Task model
- Store timestamp when task marked complete
- Display completion dates in UI
- Persist dates across commits

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Add Tasks tab to dev-stats with automatic sync from tasks.md
body:
Features:
- Created tasks.json data file with all current tasks
- Added Task and TaskSubtask types to models
- Added tasks actions, reducer, and selectors to NgRx store
- Added tasks effect to load tasks.json on init (dev mode only)
- Added Tasks tab to dev-stats component with:
  - Task cards showing title, status, subtasks, and location
  - Checkbox UI for subtasks with completed state
  - Styled task cards with status badges (pending/completed)
  - Scrollable container matching commits tab design
- Updated post-commit hook to automatically:
  - Parse tasks.md markdown format
  - Extract tasks, subtasks, locations
  - Calculate completion status from subtasks
  - Generate tasks.json in correct format

Now tasks.md is the source of truth - whenever you update it and commit,
the hook automatically syncs changes to tasks.json for the app to display.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Optimize git hooks and enhance dev stats with scrollable commit history
body:
Remove redundant pre-commit hook that duplicated post-commit functionality. Update post-commit hook to capture 100 commits instead of 9 for comprehensive git history tracking. Add scrollable container with 400px max-height to dev stats commits table, removing the 5-commit display limit to show all available commits. Document SVG refactoring task for future component reusability improvements.

body:
Replace emoji icon with custom animated SVG featuring wave gradient design and version number. Implement tabbed navigation system with Git Commits and Services Status tabs, including smooth fade-in animations and active state styling. Add placeholder for upcoming services monitoring feature with centered loading state design.

subject: Simplify intersection observer to use highest visibility ratio
body:
Removed per-component threshold configuration in favor of automatic selection based on which section occupies the most viewport space. This eliminates the need for manual threshold tuning and fixes active link detection for tall sections.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Remove NavigationService and migrate to NgRx with helper functions
body:
Refactored navigation logic to use NgRx state management and helper functions instead of a dedicated service:

- Moved navigation logic to helper functions (navigateTo, createIntersectionObserver)
- Updated BaseSectionComponent to inject Store directly and use helpers
- Updated all components (Home, About, Contact, Header) to use navigateTo helper
- Removed NavigationService and its spec file
- Maintained all intersection observer functionality with improved state management

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

author: Mannan Javid

author: Mannan Javid

subject: Fix intersection observer with continuous threshold updates
body:
The previous fix compared stale intersection ratios. Now using an array of thresholds (0, 0.05, 0.1, ..., 1.0) to ensure the observer continuously updates intersection ratios as sections scroll into view. This ensures the most visible section is accurately detected and set as active.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid

subject: Fix intersection observer to select most visible section
body:
Updated setActiveSection() to choose the section with the highest intersection ratio instead of prioritizing by order. This ensures the about section becomes active when it's more visible than home during scrolling.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
author: Mannan Javid
